                                            SECTION B

TEXT D — PROTECTING YOUR ONLINE IDENTITY AND REPUTATION

Communicative purpose: description/factual – communicate to students through written guidelines

Register and style:
The register should be in the range of semi-formal to informal. The candidate may use the second
person point of view, and this should be rewarded.
A brief introduction and conclusion should be included.
Bullet points or their equivalent are not mandatory but, if used, should be rewarded. If the text type
produced justifiably includes guidelines (e.g. set of guidelines in an e-mail), this should be
accepted.
Language accuracy is not formally assessed here and should be considered only where mistakes
obscure meaning.

Message:
The aim is to write a set of guidelines for students on how to protect one’s online identity and
reputation. The candidate should provide advice on how to deal with this aspect of using modern
technologies.

The descriptors regarding copying from the text should be carefully adhered to. Verbatim copying
of short sections of the text does NOT constitute “undue copying”; the copying of any section
(whether it be long or short) without using it appropriately and incorporating it sensibly into the
response is what constitutes undue copying.

The candidate should include some of the following details from the text:
A. a lot of what is said and done online can be retrieved even if deleted (paragraph 1)
B. ensure privacy online to protect information and photographs from being copied by others and
    shown to the world (paragraph 2)
C. frequently changing passwords prevents online “identity trashing” when a profile is hacked
    (paragraph 3)
D. pick passwords that are difficult to guess (paragraph 3)
E. never share passwords with anyone except parents or trusted adults (paragraph 3)
F. be careful of what you post online (paragraph 4) / think before posting anything (paragraph 7) –
    things that seem funny or cool right now might not seem so cool years from now (paragraph 4)
G. do not respond to inappropriate requests (paragraph 5)
H. learn about copyright laws / make sure copyrighted images, songs, or files are not posted,
    shared or distributed (paragraph 6)
I. follow the same rules for responsible behaviour online as you do offline (paragraph 7).

      To achieve level 5 (adequate understanding) at least five details should be included.
      To achieve level 9 (very good understanding) at least eight details should be included
      and conventions of form should be adhered to.
